items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, over the next three days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from today, Thursday 6 November, and over the weekend. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The Broads and river levels will remain high over the next couple of days due to tide locking from the current spring tides.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Friday 7 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 11:15pm tonight, to 1:15am tomorrow morning, Friday 7 November. 
Tide levels will be high around the boat yard in Felixstowe Ferry hamlet at the end of Ferry Road, and along riverside areas in Woodbridge and Waldringfield, as well as in surrounding marshland. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.55 mAODN at 12:15am tomorrow, Friday 7 November, which is 0.36m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, Southerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
High tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 03:45 to 05:00 on 07/11/2025. 
Locations most affected will be the North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and tidal River Esk.
We are experiencing a series of high spring tides. This alert may be reissued as a result for subsequent tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Suffolk and Essex coast from Felixstowe to Clacton including Orwell and Stour estuaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: North Sea, River Orwell, River Deben

items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 11:15pm tonight, to 1:15am tomorrow morning, Friday 7 November. 
The flood gates at Felixstowe seafront will be closed. The waterfront at Pin Mill, and The Strand at Wherstead under the Orwell Bridge may be flooded.  Water may be on the quay at Mistley. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Harwich of 2.55 mAODN at 12:15am tomorrow, Friday 7 November, which is 0.36m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, Southerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 01:45 PM to 03:45 PM on 06/11/2025. 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.70mAOD at 02:45 PM on 06/11/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 7 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain steady for the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 8:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 6.31 metres Chart Datum (3.26 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong Southerly Force 5 wind. Small amounts of water will flood land and fields at Climping. Waves will overtop the sea front, directing water westwards along Mill Lane (from the right of the East car park) towards properties on Climping Street. Water may pond near property and in Climping Street Car Park. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 15 cm lower (3.11 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. This message will be updated by 01:00 PM on 07/11/2025.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Tidal conditions are expected to improve and no flooding is expected. There are however separate tidal alerts active for Weymouth Harbour, Poole and Christchurch. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.19 m. Total forecast tide is 5.25 metres Chart Datum (2.51 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. Strong Southerly Force 5 wind. The tide will flood Shore Road. At Bosham High Street, water will be near to or flood front door steps. Gardens or land of shore side properties around the Harbour could also be affected. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 18 cm lower (2.33 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 01:00 PM on 07/11/2025.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding.  
  

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Thursday 6th to Friday 7th November. 


Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks, and harbours may be flooded. Areas particularly at risk include exposed coastal areas of Plymouth Sound, Cawsand, Kingsand, The Hoe, Millbrook & low lying areas on estuaries. High tide at Plymouth on Thursday is at 6:06pm and on Friday morning at 6:27am. Forecast total high tide levels are 2.89mAOD and 2.89mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.3m above tide table level. Force 2 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 1.8m are forecast over Thursday pm tide, rising to Force 4 Southerly and offshore wave heights of 1.4m on Friday am tide.  Coastal conditions should ease by Saturday am tide. 


We are closely monitoring the situation.  


Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded.  


This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal areas of Littlehampton Rope Walk
items.message: High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 6.31 metres Chart Datum (3.26 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong Southerly Force 5 wind. Water will be high up slipways and could flood roads through drains. If the tide comes in a little higher than we are predicting, a small amount of water could flow through The Shipyard and Boat Yards, and onto Rope Walk. With shallow depths of water potentially affecting properties of, and near, North Park. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 15 cm lower (3.11 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 01:00 PM on 07/11/2025.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:57pm to 10:57pm on 05/11/25. 
Areas most at risk include Poole Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Frome and River Piddle. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Poole of 1.41 mAODN at 8:57pm which is 0.37m above tide tables with south easterly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 6/11/25 between 07:18am and 11:18am with a peak level of 1.41 mAODN at 09:18am with southernly force 5 winds. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads and low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Gribbin Head to Rame Head
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Thursday 6th to Friday 7th of November.  

Spray and wave overtopping of low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas at risk include Fowey, Lostwithiel, Polperro Harbour, Looe, Millendreath and the B3247 at Seaton. High tide at Plymouth on Thursday is at 6:06pm and on Friday morning at 6:27am. Forecast total high tide levels are 2.89mAOD and 2.89mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels to be around 0.3m above tide table level. Force 2 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 1.8m are forecast over Thursday pm tide, rising to Force 4 Southerly and offshore wave heights of 1.4m on Friday am tide. 

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM this evening and 7:00 AM and 9:00 tomorrow morning. 
The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Avonmouth. The first forecast high water is at 7:30 PM on 06/11/2025 with a level of 7.68 mAODN with  Southerly force 2 winds. The second forecast high water is at  8:00 AM on 07/11/2025 with a level of 7.57 mAODN with South Easterly force 4 winds (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Please note all tide times are in local time and refer to the high water time at Avonmouth.
Further flooding is possible until Friday Evening. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 7:15pm to 11:15pm on 05/11/25. 
Locations most affected will be Bridge Street, Stoney Lane and Monkswell Gardens in Purewell and Christchurch Harbour. Areas most at risk include tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a high water level of 1.37 mAODN at 9:15pm this evening with south easterly force 5 winds. The second forecast high water is at 09:36am tomorrow morning with a level of 1.39 mAODN with southernly force 4 winds (mAODN is height above average sea level). Flooding is possible 2 hours either side on the high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message: The weather forecast is turning more settled for a time compared with recent days. River levels are falling but larger water bodies such as Coniston will remain high into the weekend. We continue to monitor the situation. Do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 7th November 2025.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of high tides between Thursday evening and Friday evening. 
Areas particularly at risk include Lynmouth, Combe Martin, Hele, Ilfracombe, Lee, Instow, Appledore, Westward Ho!, and Clovelly, Bideford, Barnstaple. High tide at Ilfracombe is at 6:15PM on Thursday 6th and 6:45AM on Friday 7th November, times of high water will vary along the coast. Forecast total high tide levels are 5.25mAOD and 5.14mAOD respectively, both of which are around 0.27 metres above tide table level. Force 2 to 4 south to south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 1.1m are forecast over the high tides. Coastal conditions should ease for Saturday morning's high tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:30PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high. Flooding is possible on over the next two days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech peaked at 4.26m 05/11 AM, Maesbrook peaked at 1.42m on 05/11 PM, Cae Howel 4.0m – 4.3m 06/11 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 7:00 PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of high tide between Thursday evening and Friday evening. Areas particularly at risk include communities within the Kingsbridge, Dart and Teign estuaries. The high tides at Plymouth are at 6:00PM on Thursday 6th and 6:30AM on Friday 7th November, times of high water will vary along the coast. Forecast total high tide levels are 2.89mAOD and 2.88mAOD respectively, which are up to 0.30 metres above tide table level. Force 3 to 4 south to south easterly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 1.8m are forecast over the high tide. Coastal conditions should ease for Saturday morning's high tide. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 12:30PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at midnight on 07/11/2025.
Flooding is possible at low lying lands and roads from 00:00 AM on 07/11/2025 at the following locations:
Fiddlers Ferry, peaking around 00:30 AM.
Eastford Road, peaking around 00:45 AM.
Arpley Bridge, peaking around 01:00 AM.
Knutsford Road, peaking around 01:15 AM.
It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge.   
We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 2 days and as a result we may issue further alerts/warnings.
Our incident rooms are open and we are closely monitoring the situation.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 07/11/2025, or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday morning's tide at 11:30 on 07/11/2025 and 13:42 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 4.08 metres Chart Datum (2.24 mAOD) at Beaulieu. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. The tide will flood into the garden of the mill house on the downstream side of the Mill Pond. Minor road flooding at Palace Lane is also expected, making access to the village temporarily more difficult. Friday's tide at 23:45 on 07/11/2025 is forecast to be 21 cm lower (2.03 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 10:00AM to 12:00PM on 06/11/2025. 
We are in a period of high tides and a Flood Alert is expected to remain in force for the following tides that also meet Flood Alert Level. Next high tides are 06/11/2025 11:30PM and 07/11/2025 12:00PM.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Todays lunchtime tide, 6/11/2025, does not meet Flood Alert level but will still be high.

High water is possible from 10:15AM on 6/11/2025 to 12:15PM on 06/11/2025. 

We remain in a period of high tides and a Flood Alert is expected to remain in force for this period. Next high tides are 06/11/2025 11:45PM and 08/11/2025 00:30AM.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the coast. 

We are closely monitoring the situation .and closing flood gates where necessary. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The north Norfolk coast from Old Hunstanton, to and including Cley
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 5:45am to 7:45am tomorrow morning, Friday 7 November. 
We expect to see water on roads and paths to beaches and on the quays in Brancaster, Burnham Overy, Holkham, Wells and Blakeney.  The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Wells of 3.62 mAODN at 6:45am tomorrow, Friday 7 November, which is 0.29m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, South Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible from 5:45am to 7:45am tomorrow morning, Friday 7 November. 
We may see water on Beach Road at Cley, and Beach Road at Salthouse, and footpaths in the marshes may also become inaccessible. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at Wells of 3.62 mAODN at 6:45am tomorrow, Friday 7 November, which is 0.29m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, South Easterly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded .

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: Higher than normal tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 05:45 to 07:45 on 07/11/2025. Locations affected will be the North Sea coast from Mappleton to Spurn Point and in particular around Spurn Road. We are experiencing a series of high spring tides. This alert may be reissued as a result for subsequent tides. We are closely monitoring the situation . Avoid coastal footpaths, which may be flooded . This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 06 November 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay on Wye peaked at 3.0m 05/11 AM, Bredwardine peaked at 4.7m on 05/11 PM, Belmont peaked 4.8m on 05/11 PM, Old Wye Bridge peaked at 4.2m on 05/11 PM, Mordiford peaked at 4.3m on 06/11 AM, Ross on Wye 3.6m to 3.8m on 06/11 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 7PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
A flood alert has been issued by the Environment Agency. 

Flood alert in force: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester.

Flooding is possible for: River Dee in England covers areas around Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. 

River levels remain high which may lead to flooding. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Townfield Lane may be cut off. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.  
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.    
We will continue to monitor the situation and work with emergency services and local authorities.    
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 07 November 2025 1.5 hours before, and 3.5 hours after the tide at 11:30. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 5.17 metres Chart Datum (2.43 mAOD) at Southampton. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Levels in the lower River Itchen will increase as the incoming tide prevents water from flowing out to sea. Footpath flooding will affect some areas of Riverside Park. The pub car park at Mansbridge, may see minor impact flooding for a short period of time. Any flood depth would be relatively shallow. The tide will not flood property or the A27. Friday's tide at 23:45 on 07/11/2025 is forecast to be 23 cm lower (2.2 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday morning's tide at 11:30 on 07/11/2025 and 13:42 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. Total forecast tide is 5.17 metres Chart Datum (2.43 mAOD) at Southampton. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Very minor impact flooding will affect the lower floor level of Eling Tide Mill and boat yards at Bursledon. Road and car park flooding may occur at The Quay Hamble, Magazine Lane at Marchwood and Shore Road in Hythe. Friday's tide at 23:45 on 07/11/2025 is forecast to be 23 cm lower (2.2 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 5.33 metres Chart Datum (2.60 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Levels will be high at South Street and Queen Street Emsworth. The Ship Inn car park, Langstone will flood. Water will flow across the A259 junction with Lumley Road, flooding driveways. Water will flow into the road at Langstone High Street. Flood depths in the road will be up to 0.1m deep, and should only cause impacts nearest to the harbour front. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.41 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday morning's tide at 11:41 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.12 m. Total forecast tide is 4.67 metres Chart Datum (2.08 mAOD) at Cowes. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Very minor impact flooding will affect some sea front roads, esplanades and car parks across the island. Water will be high up slipways in Cowes, affecting Medina Road and the floating bridge. In East Cowes, sea water forced up through drains may cause very minor impacts to the road at Albany Road. Friday's tide at 23:56 on 07/11/2025 is forecast to be 23 cm lower (1.85 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall Coast from Lands End to Lizard Point
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions over the next two days may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible over the high tides from Thursday 6th to Friday 7th November  

Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas particularly at risk include Newlyn, Penzance, Porthleven and Longrock. High tide at Newlyn on Thursday is at 4:54pm and on Friday morning at 5:15am. Forecast total high tide level is 3.14mAOD and 3.10mAOD respectively. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.3 metres above tide table level. Force 2 South Easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 2.5m are forecast over Thursday pm tide, rising to Force 4 Southerly and offshore wave heights of 2.0m on Friday am tide. Coastal conditions should ease by Saturday am tide.   

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from Lands End to Chapel Porth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible over the high tide on the evening of Thursday 6 November. 
Areas particularly at risk include low lying coastal locations including St Ives Harbour, Portreath Harbour and the Causeway at Hayle. The high tide at St Ives on Thursday evening is at 17:25. Forecast total high tide level is 4.02mAOD. 
Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.3m above tide table level. Force 1 easterly winds and offshore wave heights of 1.6m are forecast over the high tide. Coastal conditions should ease by Friday AM tide. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
We do not expect to see similar impacts from the next high tide. The risk from high tides today has passed, however we fully expect to issue another flood alert for high tide at Clacton tomorrow lunchtime. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 4:12pm to 8:12pm on 05/11/25. 
Areas most at risk include West Bay Harbour and the tidal stretch of the River Brit. The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at West Bay of 2.60 mAODN at 6:12pm which is 0.36m above tide tables, with southernly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 06/11/25 between 04:39am and 08:39am with a peak level of 2.62 mAODN at 06:39am with southernly force 4 winds. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 6pm today 06/11/25 and tomorrow morning from 7am, 07/11/25 
A series of high tides is due over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow. Predicted peaks:- Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m this evening, 06/11/25, Newport 7.1m to 7.3m this evening , 06/11/25. Tomorrow morning's high tide is forecast between 7 and 8 am, 07/11/25, predicted peaks :- Avonmouth Portbury 7.3m to 7.6m, Newport 7.0m to 7.2m. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible over the high tide on the evening of Thursday 6 November. 
Areas particularly at risk include low-lying land, roads and carparks, particularly at Little Petherick. The high tide at Padstow on Thursday evening is at 17:36. Forecast total high tide level is 4.57mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be up to 0.4m above tide table level. Force 2 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of up to 1.6m are forecast over the high tide. Coastal conditions should ease by Friday morning. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High tides overnight may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible between 22:45 and 00:45 on 06th November 2025 into 07th November 2025. 

The current forecast shows we are likely to see spray overtopping during the midnight high tide tonight.

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

High river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 06 November 2025.  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bankfull at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Predicted peaks:- Crew Green peaked at 5.6m 06/11 AM, Montford 4.5m – 4.8m on 06/11 AM, Welshbridge 2.3m – 2.6m on 06/11 PM, Buildwas 3.0m – 3.5m on 07/11 AM.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated by 7:00 PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 11:45pm tonight, to 1:45am tomorrow morning, Friday 7 November. 
Areas most at risk are Coalhouse Fort and car park, and the low lying land between the fort and Coalhouse Point. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Southend of 3.50 mAODN at 12:45am tomorrow, Friday 7 November, which is 0.37m above tide tables, Wind Force 3, Southerly. Tides are expected to be higher than usual, due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from St Margaret's at Cliffe to Sandgate
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
Higher than normal tides tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 09:30 to 13:30 on Friday 7 November 2025. 
Flooding will be localised and low lying land near the coast is expected to be most affected, particularly around Dover, Folkestone and St Margaret's at Cliffe. The detailed forecast is for a peak tide of 3.65m AoD at Dover at 11:30. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High tides tomorrow morning (07/11) may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 07:30 - 08:15 on Friday morning (07/11). 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 17:00PM on 06 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding tomorrow morning. 
Flooding is expected from 05:30 to 06:30 on 07/11/2025. 
Locations most affected will be properties on the east side of Kilnsea, including Kilnsea Caravan Park, and Easington Caravan Park.
We are experiencing a series of high spring tides. This warning may be reissued as a result for subsequent tides. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Start acting on your flood plan if you have one . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
We do not expect to see similar impacts from the next high tide. Although this evening's tide is the highest in the cycle, the wind force has reduced significantly since yesterday. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Areas most at risk include Weymouth Harbour and the tidal stretch of the River Wey, Commercial Road Car Park, Weymouth may be inaccessible .The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Weymouth Harbour of 1.85 mAODN at 6:15pm which is 0.35m above tide tables, with south easterly force 4 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.). Further flooding is possible during the morning high tide of the 06/11/25 between 04:45am and 08:45am with a peak level of 1.87 mAODN at 06:45am with south easterly force 4 winds.

items.description: Isle of Sheppey and coast from Kemsley to Seasalter
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High tides overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 11:00 PM on Thursday 06/11/2025 to 03:00 AM on Friday 07/11/2025. 
The forecast peak high water level for the overnight high tide is 3.46 m AOD at 01:00 AM on Friday 07/11/2025.

Areas most at risk include low lying land, promenades and coastal footpaths.

High spring tides tomorrow afternoon may also lead to flooding between 11:15 AM and 03:15 PM on Friday 07/11/2025. The forecast peak high water level for tomorrow afternoon's high tide is 3.55 m AOD at 01:15 PM.

High spring tides are expected to continue over the coming days so the risk of flooding may continue. We will update this Flood Alert message with other high tides as necessary. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Please take care because large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: The Solent, Portsmouth Harbour, Langstone Harbour

items.message:
High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 5.33 metres Chart Datum (2.60 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. In Old Portsmouth, the tide may just exceed the top of the main slipway which will cause minor road flooding in East Street and to the boat yards at The Camber. To protect property in Old Portsmouth, tidal defence gates will be closed. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.41 mAOD). 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Friday afternoon's tide at 12:00 on 07/11/2025. 
The weather increases tide table values by 0.22 m. Total forecast tide is 5.33 metres Chart Datum (2.60 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Light Southerly Force 4 wind. Water may just exceed the top of the main slipway, flooding the road at Lower Quay, Fareham. The lower end of Wallington Shore Road will flood to a depth of 0.1m. Saturday's tide at 00:15 on 08/11/2025 is forecast to be 19 cm lower (2.41 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 07 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
